Articles.Content:
I'm a little fan of KSP and I love to watch videos or play by myself, since KSP 1 was very lowreq I could play wherever I wanted.

Now with the sequel the story its a little bit more complicated, and theres a ton of people who are the same as me. Bussy people who can't play much videogames when they're out of their homes.

With that in mind I think it would be nice to have KSP 2 in a cloud service such as GFN who could let us play wherever and whenever we want. Plus, you have to still purchase the game in the platform you want, so its not a big inconvenience for the dev company.

I agree.

In fact I refrained from buying KSP2 EA because my I know pc won't be able to handle it. Seeing it on GFN would change this
I bought KSP2 yesterday on steam but sadly had to return it because it's not available on Geforce NOW. I'll buy it again as soon as GFN is supported.
I would really like to see KSP2 on Nvidia GeForce Now as well. I love love LOVE KSP, but need it on a cloud service like GFN for this to be accessible to me!

+1

I'll totally buy KSP2 and all DLCs, but only if it's available on GFN, not going to buy a new PC.
It probably won't change anything, but I also won't buy KSP2 because I don't have PC powerful enough and I don't intend to buy one just because of this game .
Yes please add KSP to GeForce Now! I won't be able to play it on my potato...

Being the 8th poster and necroing this thread makes it seem doubtful that TakeTwo will take this seriously, but I too would only considering buying KSP2 if it's available on a cloud service (doesn't have to be Nvidia's) since the requirements for max graphics are kind of steep.
If GFN adds modding support for KSP if they add KSP 2 this will be a huge win for game modders like me and the modding community and i will 100% buy the game
